title: How to Draw a Cartoon Panda

steps.headline: Draw a circular figure, but don't finish the circle on the left side at the bottom.
steps.description: In the middle and close to the bottom draw a small circle. The small circle should be close to the space where you didn't finish the bigger circle.

steps.headline: Draw the hands and feet.
steps.description: One hand should be covering the place where you didn't finish the bigger circle. The hands and feet are both black, so you won't see a line that defines both individually.

steps.headline: Draw the ears.
steps.description: They should start a 10 and 2 'o' clock and end at 8 and 4.

steps.headline: Draw the blackness around the eyes and the nose right under.
steps.description: The top of the blackness should start right where the ears end.

steps.headline: Connect the feet to define the body and add the eyes.
Detail the ears and feet.
steps.description: Just put semi-circles in the ears and ovals in the feet.

steps.headline: Add a couple pieces of hair on the head.
Shade in the blackness of the fur.

text: Draw a circular figure, but don't finish the circle on the left side at the bottom. In the middle and close to the bottom draw a small circle. The small circle should be close to the space where you didn't finish the bigger circle. Draw the hands and feet. One hand should be covering the place where you didn't finish the bigger circle. The hands and feet are both black, so you won't see a line that defines both individually. Draw the ears. They should start a 10 and 2 'o' clock and end at 8 and 4. Draw the blackness around the eyes and the nose right under. The top of the blackness should start right where the ears end. Connect the feet to define the body and add the eyes.  Detail the ears and feet. Just put semi-circles in the ears and ovals in the feet. Add a couple pieces of hair on the head.  Shade in the blackness of the fur.  Enjoy what you have drawn :)
